item.description: Structure Fire; INC#1556; 08:43PM; 1914 E 97th St; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/3iamLbqRbi29n6KC8; #Watts; Auto fire, which spread to the adjacent one-story home, causing an attic fire. Offensive mode.; FS 65; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 15; BC13 BC706 E21 E233 E264 E64 E65 RA65 RA865 T33 T64; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Traffic-related Water Rescue; INC#1229; 06:22PM; 19000 W Oxnard St; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/LqWqMB2561WZs9h79; #Tarzana; Several vehicles are disabled in 2-3 feet of water at the intersection of Oxnard St and Donna Ave (and flooding extending between Wilbur and Tampa). No reported injuries, and thankfully the vehicle occupants have remained in their vehicles and not risked going out into the deep water with unpredictable terrain and currents below the surface. LAFD Swiftwater Teams are preparing to send a watercraft out to the vehicles to bring the occupants to safety. ROAD CLOSURE: Due to the flooding, Oxnard will be closed between Wilbur and Tampa. This may result in wider impacts to the immediate area for commuters. Please seek alternate routes and do not attempt to cross flooded roadways. ; FS 93; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; E293 SC1 SW88 T93; CH8; 17; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/04/2024 INC#0803

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0803; 02:15PM; 560 S Vermont Av; #Koreatown; Firefighters responded to a 13-story boarded-up high-rise building with smoke showing from the upper floors. Crews located a large amount of rubbish burning on the first floor. The smoke filled the building all the way up to the top floor, where the smoke found a way out of the sealed high rise building. Firefighters quickly extinguished the rubbish, but will now be performing a complex ventilation operation to evacuate the smoke from all 13 floors. Firefighters found several people inside, who were effectively rescued. Ultimately, it took 78 firefighters 30 minutes to access, confine, and extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC706 CM20 CM22 E11 E13 E20 E211 E220 E226 E227 E229 E26 E261 E29 E3 E52 E6 E87 EA1 EM1 EM11 EM14 EM5 HR3 RA11 RA13 RA3 RA52 RA6 RA803 RA811 RA813 SO1 SQ21 SQ87 T11 T20 T26 T27 T29 T61 UR3 UR88; CH7; 13 14 16; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0803; 02:15PM; 3190 W 6th St; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/bNaRzJvTQGffxEyc9; #Koreatown; Approximately 13-story high rise (vacant) with smoke showing from multiple floors. Offensive mode.; FS 13; Batt 11; Central Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC706 CM20 CM22 E11 E13 E20 E211 E220 E226 E227 E229 E26 E261 E29 E3 E52 E6 E87 EM1 EM11 EM14 EM5 HR3 RA11 RA13 RA3 RA52 RA6 RA803 RA811 RA813 SO1 SQ21 SQ87 T11 T20 T26 T27 T29 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/04/2024 INC#0602

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0602; 12:33PM; 4404 E Toland Pl; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/2QDJZ29PQH923YG39; #EagleRock; Firefighters responded to an *ascending* hillside home that was two stories, plus an attic converted to a living space. Crews made access to the structure, advancing hose lines and achieving roof ventilation, but excessive storage inside fueled a rapidly growing fire, which forced firefighters to retreat into defensive mode (fighting from the exterior only). While the structure was a total loss, firefighters successfully defended the nearby vegetation and adjacent homes. Thankfully, both residents and their canine, who were home at the time of the fire, escaped without harm. They will be displaced and Red Cross is responding to assist them, and LAFD will issue a SAVE card (Supplying Aid to Victims of Emergency) for some financial assistance. Ultimately, it took 74 firefighters 57 min to access, confine, and extinguish the flames. No reported injuries. The cause of the fire is under investigation. 74 ff 57min; FS 55; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; AR1 BC1 BC14 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E12 E201 E203 E212 E220 E227 E235 E250 E27 E42 E44 E55 E56 EA1 EM1 EM11 EM5 HR3 RA12 RA27 RA55 RA56 RA827 RA850 SO1 SQ21 T1 T12 T20 T27 T3 T35 T50 UR27 UR88; CH7; 12 13 15; Nicholas Prange

title.a: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/04/2024 INC#0602

item.description: Update Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0602; 12:25PM; 4404 E Toland Pl; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/nwwZP4ZyBCvj4aVW8; #EagleRock; Firefighters continue to battle flames in the two-story hillside home, now in defensive mode. The home contains excessive storage that impedes firefighters' access and provides extra fuel for the fire to burn. Firefighters have been able to keep the fire from spreading to the brush that surrounds the home. ; FS 55; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC1 BC14 BC2 BC5 CM20 CM22 E1 E12 E201 E203 E212 E220 E227 E235 E250 E27 E42 E44 E55 E56 EA1 EM1 EM11 EM5 HR3 RA12 RA27 RA55 RA56 RA827 RA850 SO1 SQ21 T1 T12 T20 T27 T3 T35 T50 UR27 UR88; CH9; 12 13 15; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0575; 11:19AM; 7142 1/2 S Ramsgate Av; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/qxR77GYC8v4aQmcB7; #Westchester; Twenty-eight LAFD firefighters extinguished flames in one unit of a multi-family residential structure in 30 minutes. Crews contained the flames to just one unit. No reported injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 5; Batt 4; West Bureau; Council District 11; BC18 BC9 E205 E266 E51 E63 E67 RA57 RA866 T5 T66; CH9; 12; Nicholas Prange

Structure Fire; INC#0602; 11:36AM; 4404 E Toland Pl; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/VeGkLpPm2RQjxMr6A; #EagleRock; Two-story descending hillside home with heavy fire showing from the second floor. Offensive mode.; FS 55; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 1; BC2 BC5 E12 E212 E250 E42 E55 RA55 RA850 T12 T50; CH9; 13; Nicholas Prange

EVACUATION ORDER; 09:15AM; MAP: https://lafd.maps.arcgis.com/apps/Media/index.html?appid=ba8cfed4b4a04d49b7489eb8300727a8; #ShadowHills; EVACUATE NOW due to the high risk of debris flow triggered by heavy rain from the storm impacting the area today through Tuesday. The EVACUATION ORDER is for the La Tuna Canyon Road area, with borders of Horse Haven Street to the North, Martindale Avenue to the East, Penrose Street to the South, Ledge Avenue to the West. Evacuation Centers for people and household pets have opened at Sunland Senior Citizen Center (8640 Fenwick St, Sunland, CA 91040) and Lake View Terrace Recreation Center (11075 Foothill Blvd, Lake View Terrace, CA 91342). Large animals can be evacuated to Hansen Dam Horse Park (11127 Orcas Ave. Lake View Terrace, CA 91342) and the LA Equestrian Center (480 Riverside Dr, Burbank, CA 91506). Check lafd.org/alerts for updates on this evacuation order. Debris flows can bring water, mud, boulders, and other debris that can cover cars and houses. Pack all people and pets into your vehicle and leave the area immediately. More information, including a map, can be found at www.lafd.org/news EVACUEN AHORA debido al flujo de escombros de alto riesgo provocado por las fuertes lluvias de la tormenta que impactaran el área desde hoy hasta el martes. La ORDEN DE EVACUACIÓN es para el área La Tuna Canyon Road, con límites de Horse Haven St. al norte, Martindale Ave. al este, Penrose St al sur, Ledge Ave al oeste. Se han abierto refugios para personas y mascotas domésticas en Sunland Senior Citizen Center (8640 Fenwick St, Sunland, CA 91040) y Lake View Terrace Recreation Center (11075 Foothill Blvd, Lake View Terrace, CA 91342). Los animales grandes pueden ser evacuados al Hansen Dam Horse Park (11127 Orcas Ave. Lake View Terrace, CA 91342) y al LA Equestrian Center (480 Riverside Dr, Burbank, CA 91506). Visite lafd.org/alerts para obtener actualizaciones sobre esta orden de evacuación. Los flujos de escombros pueden traer agua, lodo, rocas y otros escombros que pueden cubrir automóviles y casas. Empaque a todas las personas y mascotas en su vehículo y abandone el área inmediatamente. Puede encontrar más información, incluido un mapa, en www.lafd.org/news; Nicholas Prange

title.a: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire 02/03/2024 INC#1609

item.description: KNOCKDOWN Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#1609; 11:51PM; 7255 N Clybourn Av; MAP: https://maps.app.goo.gl/ayaoto8T2gajhhQu9; #SunValley; It took 78 firefighters 61 minutes operating in defensive mode to extinguish the blaze consuming the 80' x 120' one-story commercial structure. One man from the scene was transported to a local hospital with a medical complaint (not directly related to smoke or fire). LAFD Heavy Equipment and RS3 (remote firefighting vehicle) will be performing an extended operation to ensure all the hot spots and smoldering debris are uncovered for extinguishment. No firefighter injuries. Cause under investigation.; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; AR1 BC11 BC12 BC14 BC5 CM40 CM42 E102 E227 E239 E260 E27 E278 E289 E298 E60 E75 E77 E86 E87 E89 EA1 EM14 EM5 HE1 HR3 PI3 RA77 RA86 RA889 RA89 RS3 SO1 SQ87 T27 T39 T60 T78 T89 T98 UR27 UR88; CH8; 12 13 15; Nicholas Prange
